intro: Tacsonia mixta var. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered tacsonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are characterized by their elongated petals and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland environments.
